document.heading: Increase Rate of Interest on Special Assignments Act of 1977

history.narrative: Law 2-52, the “Increase Rate of Interest on Special Assignments Act of 1977,” was introduced in Council and assigned Bill No. 2-185, which was referred to the Committee on Finance and Revenue and to the Committee on Housing and Urban Development for comments. The Bill was adopted on first and second readings on October 11, 1977 and October 25, 1977, respectively. Signed by the Mayor on December 7, 1977, it was assigned Act No. 2-113 and transmitted to both Houses of Congress for its review.
